topic.title: Zeronet Tor Trackers
topic.body: I noticed that there is like only 1 default zero net trackers. Any other tor trackers?

1_1B5iBCuHQgbGdgTJmM2A2pZNVfpfp3EU5u.body:
you can use hugo and probably even hexo, since these output static files. 

For hugo, just have to copy the "public/" folder to the zeronet folder that corresponds to your zero site
For hexo, just deploy via rsync to the zeronet folder that corresponds to your zero site

IDK how to do it with jekyllrb but I am sure as heck there is a way, you just need to copy the files it outputs to your zeronet site folder.

Hugo example
http://127.0.0.1:43110/126fBtopb2n7Pc42KhZyZyHhZKrecAdMdR/

11_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd.body: Yeah zeronet is more like a more security relaxed and modern web technology version of freenet.

1_1PqLL4biB8q67AMyeDJCYz34EihFDVzXBp.body: It can be, however people are too stupid to click install so we need more proxies imo.

1_16KZw5gzYyBdfuW9HSUZiGHmayCEXunYZU.body:
you can make a board, similar to this one, or make our own leftchan here. I hadn't thought about it but its a simple 1 2 click.

I wouldn't be so quick to say that anarchists dominate ZN because not that long ago there were a bunch of chinese people(they were writing in mandarin but its still an assumption on my part), then before that a bunch of Trump supporters(or alt-right people?), etc. etc.

Honestly, I think ZN is mostly filled with trolls than anything else... but what do we expect from the internet?

I do consider myself an anarchist. Specifically I guess I am an ancom, but thats because I don't trust people like "band together" and do good or take care of people. (we should care for one another but that is because I am also a christian)

I like to operate on a distrust model. I assume the worst "X" until I see otherwise. (yes, I am aware communism corrupts but I also advocate for allowing watch dog organizations to keep people in government on the straight and narrow path)

> [planespherev3](#comment_213_1HYB4Pe6irbQgDbeKm1zeFD7M8pdbksFeS): Too bad so many anarchists here still believe in representative democracy.  [...]

I wouldn't be so quick to that either. Well again it depends where you are looking at. I certainly wouldn't blame the anarchists to believe in representative democracy because I know from experience that people are lemmings. (the problem of "mob mentality" and "cognitive dissonance" is strong with our societies and it is dangerous)

They will follow any "cause" so long as you make it relateable or entertaining enough for them. One day they will advocate overthrowing the state, the next... they advocate for "X" stupid thing.

Long example... (tl;dr below)

I personally believe we should be like Jesus, basically live humbly and not give a shit about the government.  if you read the part of the bible that talks *specifically* about Jesus and in particularly his disregard for both roman law and jewish law (in matthew, john, luke, and mark), we can actually see that Jesus is acting like an anarchist, he tells us that we shouldn't be concerned with the jewish laws; we should just LIVE peacefully and he rebelled against the jews who thought all 600 laws (however many, idk) there fair and just. (mind you Jesus also told his followers to just pay their taxes but did not really acknowledge the title/power the Caesar held when crucified)

However as much as I like Jesus and compare him to an anarchist, we know he was very compassionate, he explicitly told his followers to unconditionally love... However, I have to remember that after Jesus died, the catholic church took christianity all over the place: "its about sin and we should be sorry (live in penance or spread Jesus via *force*)", "no gay is a worse sin than drinking because...?", "oh but we should worry about abortions, never mind the bible preaches the opposite of pro-life"... and many christian people just lose sight of the original idealism that Jesus gives us. 

basically the same shit we see in every god damn religion; love one another... and yet this is so hard for many religious people to do. 

tl;dr... I can't think of a better example of a lemming example than the church I grew up in. People think lies just because a priest (a person of "power") says its true and do not bother to think critically or understand the truth. (and yes that truth involves even questioning God, we may not be that special or complex)

whatever, here you go. A board for talking all things anarchy. (ancoms, ancaps, etc rejoice)

slide to the little "burger" (the settings button on the top right hand) to the right and select "download and help distribute all files" and we can all just host the damn thing.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MUdFSVRfzKrW9zvvQbebGk2VDekcYXtW9

It should work unless... I'm dumb. (which is entirely possible)

1_1Ho48cxWwRFdDChHksp1fhdPvGmpaiZfcH.body:
" host internet sites that don't get pulled down by different powers in the world."
You came to the right place friend. The only way to censor zeronet, i2p, and IPFS is if the government begins to censor at the DNS level but even then, these systems can still work with ease if they decide to remove DNS records, censor IP ranges, and what not.


"I don't know if ZeroNet itself is the future or some other solution but I am really interested in the way it works with it's decentralized solution."
Yeah zeronet isn't the only solution. I personally would love it if freenet won this war because it does not require the use of javascript... but where I live, my ISP will slow me down the instant I start running it.

Whichever wins it will have to be a very adaptable and modular system. I agree.

8_18Cxdyc2FEuswoXnBkrAfCkM2Yu1p4NjcR.body:
Since Zeronet is peer to peer do we really need it to distribute content? people that like things just need to click a little button to distribute content.

What this would be for is for content providers I assume? 

but in that case I think a zeronet version of say like patreon would suffice.

What other usecases would enabling a miner in the browser really do for Zeronet or people that make content?

1530451214_12rREqqdMUPsAPuMR1p87Zj8TS4Yo.body:
> [pag](#comment_6_1Bppp2Vnp1JiQQyhL6JFsP8Gznfb8cKAB5): A genetics origin for homosexuality makes no sense. Homosexual couples will naturally have fewer children than heterosexuals, so this trait would have been selected against and it would have disappeared over time.

Things like cancer and auto immune diseases can proliferate via genetics as a deficiency of certain genetic traits.

A composite gene that needs 2 or more flags missing can cause things like MS or make a person prone to other auto immune diseases.

Studies have also found there are hormonal components to sexuality. Things like increased levels of progesterone in people seem to have a co-relation with people whom are willing or able to accept having a homosexual encounter.

There is certainly a genetic component we are missing.

1571185468_15io4gegLAkgg9jNErcMyY6bpD64H.body: Be gay and do crime, brother

1571752607_1E8JhJj7ukAx8ukr1iwV4Qvgn3UZk.body:
you have to give it time to load all the posts. I don't normally boot into zeronet but when I do I have to wait like around 4-8 hours to see all posts from large volume sites like millchan. (mind you I go offline for months at a time and load zeronet off a usb portable hard drive on a machine that is 8 years old)

Remember the site isn't hosted on a central server all the posts and stuff is on your hard drive so if you have an old machine or a mechanical spinning drive it will take some time to load all the hundreds of freaking thumbnails.

Decentralized does not necessarily mean faster than what you are used to seeing other normie sites like 4chan or 8chan or 2chan or whatever.

1580063953_14waGGyqPBKFdRMxWBKAtg4Ux1b8a.body:
enable tor only mode through bridges you trust and you can access zeronet from deep web. 

another thing you can do is buy a host on a VPS and run zeronet from there via a VPN or SSH port forwarding.

1580020434_1Q3oCEsSUjRyGDFVTvS3Kq8qdp6TV.body:
it needs a UI revamp. Like its great in theory F2F networks are really great for privacy and really hard for state like adversaries from attacking them but the UI is so shit. 

its laggy, permissions on sharing are confusing and tedious if you have a group larger than 20, the web ui lacks features. 

but its like a better alt to like freenet imo.

1580253527_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: piratebox is a favorite but its more federated.

- 7zip full AES encryption
- Stegosnow (or a variant I am working on)
